field.label: Disable preempt
field.help: When this device is configured as CARP master it will try to switch to master when powering up, this option will keep this one slave if there already is a master on the network. A reboot is required to take effect.

field.label: Disconnect dialup interfaces
field.help: When this device is configured as CARP backup it will disconnect all PPP type interfaces and try to reconnect them when becoming master again.

field.label: Synchronize all states via
field.help: This enables state insertion, update, and deletion messages between firewalls by utilizing the selected interface for communication. Best choose a dedicated interface for this type of communication to prevent manipulation of states causing security issues.

field.label: Sync compatibility
field.help: Newer versions of OPNsense offer additional attributes in the state synchronization, for compatibility reasons you can optionally choose an older version here. Always make sure both nodes use the same version to avoid inconsistent state tables.

field.label: Synchronize Peer IP
field.help: Setting this option will force pfsync to synchronize its state table to this IP address. The default is directed multicast.

field.label: Defer pfsync
field.help: Defer transmission of the first packet in a state until a peer has acknowledged that the associated state has been inserted. This adds small delays but allows traffic to flow when more than one firewall might actively handle packets ("active/active")

field.label: Configuration Synchronization Settings (XMLRPC Sync) Perform synchronization
Synchronize Config
field.help: Enter the IP address of the firewall to which the selected configuration sections should be synchronized. This should be empty on the backup machine. When an IP address is offered, both web GUI configurations should be equal (port and protocol).

field.label: Verify peer
field.help: In most cases the target host will be a directly attached neighbor in which case TLS verification can be ignored.

field.label: Remote System Username
field.help: Enter the web GUI username of the system entered above for synchronizing your configuration.

field.label: Remote System Password
field.help: Enter the web GUI password of the system entered above for synchronizing your configuration.

field.label: Services
field.help: Select the services that should be send to the other host.
